brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts an activity in which you must match the hierarchical layer label to the correct layer in the three-layer hierarchical design in the diagram. This is a similar topology to Section 1.1.1, Diagram 1, but with additional examples of device icons. Cable types and various devices are also identified in the activity.

Layer Labels:
A: Distribution
B: Core
C: Access

Network Areas:
One: End-user devices and Layer 2 switches.
Two: Intermediate multilayer switches to which the Layer 2 switches connect.
Three: Top layer multilayer switches that connect to the network cloud.

Supplemental device and cabling icon information.
Cable icons include a crossover, which is depicted by a dashed black line, a straight-through, which is depicted by a solid black line, and a WAN link, which is depicted by a red lightning bolt.

Devices and end-user icons include an access server, access switch, core multilayer switch, distribution multilayer switch, home office, teleworker, VPN gateway, and a wireless router.
